attributes.action: Make it possible for any baby to have a birth and death certificate after labour
attributes.background: Having gone through an early labour at 21 weeks and giving birth to a beautiful baby girl, who sadly died seconds after birth, I was heartbroken to realise that her short life would not be recognised legally on this earth with a birth and death certificate. This option should be available to parents
attributes.additional_details:
The current law in England and Wales is that in order to file a birth and death certificate the child must be born after 24 weeks of pregnancy.

The NHS currently offer a hospital-based commemorative certification, however this is not a legal document or proof of life and death. 

No matter the week of pregnancy any parents of a laboured birth should have the option to file for a birth and death certificate.

attributes.action: Review rules that allow male prisoners who identify as female in women's prisons
attributes.background: Fair Play For Women is calling for MPs to ensure the relevant prison rules are urgently reviewed, in full consultation with women's organisations. Prison guidance PSI-17/2016 allows male prisoners who identity as female to be moved to a female prison at the discretion of a Transgender Case Board.
attributes.additional_details: No women's organisations were consulted when the prison rules were updated in 2016. The effect on female prisoners has not been adequately assessed. Current rules are not fit for purpose and must be urgently reviewed.

attributes.action: No cap or limit on compensation for Windrush Generation and their descendants
attributes.background: We want a fair compensation scheme for the Windrush Generation that is in line with compensation awarded by the courts in civil cases. There should be no artificial cap that will inadequately compensate those who have suffered emotionally, financially, lost their homes and citizenship.
attributes.additional_details:
Six months since Windrush Scandal was exposed there has been some progress and numerous apologies from the Prime Minster.The government intend to introduce a cap on all compensation claims despite the fact they did not recognise or consider any interim or hardship fund. The Windrush Generation plus others from the Commonwealth have paid their taxes and contributed to the wealth, prosperity and cultural identity of UK since WW2.The scheme needs to reflect this.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-44888187

attributes.action: Legal requierment for A/C to be working correctly on Public Service Vehicles
attributes.background: Working as a Bus Driver in London I frequently come across buses where the Heaters and/or Air Conditioning (A/C) is not working correctly as the operator is NOT legally required to maintain them. Therefore, I feel it’s about time that it is a legal requirement for Heaters and A/C to be working.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, you cannot transport cattle at temperatures higher than 30C, so why do people not have similar legal rights to travel in comfort. If you agree then please sign the petition and share.

attributes.action: National Minimum Wage for SIA License Holders at 40% above Normal Minimum Wage
attributes.background: With Minimum Wage rising and coming in line with Security Organisations pay rate, the government should protect License Holders and impose a 40% raise above the National Minimum Wage. Minimum Wage is currently at £7.83, with a 40% increase License Holders would receive £10.96 minimum an hour.
attributes.additional_details: Many companies have failed to raise the wages of Security Officers due to profit constraints in security servicing contracts. The government should role out a mandatory 40% increase against minimum wage in which the contractor must pay its License Holders once contracts have been renewed or at the next available opportunity. The 40% increase should then be processed at each Minimum Wage rise to maintain a competitive pay industry.

attributes.action: Petition calling for a review of Nottingham City Councils Selective Licensing.
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to carry out a review of Nottingham City Councils Selective Licensing Scheme.

We believe areas of Nottingham have been unfairly targeted and included in the Licensing Scheme which do not meet the government guidance conditions for Selective Licensing.
attributes.additional_details:
Particular areas such as the Park Estate, Mapperley Park, Wilford and the City Centre are examples of areas we believe have been wrongly included. They include modern apartment developments, affluent residential suburbs and luxury homes which do not meet any of the conditions for selective licensing.

We urge the Government to review the proposed scheme and the areas selected to ensure they do meet the Governments conditions for Selective Licensing before the scheme is allowed to commence.

attributes.action: Formally request the EU allow UK citizens to request EU citizenship after Brexit
attributes.background:
It is clear that only 36% of the UK population voted for Brexit despite the more publicised voter turnout of 51.89% leave voters

The EU would agree that 64% of UK citizens (quite possibly more now) would like to remain or at the least retain EU citizenship as they oppose solo UK citizenship

attributes.action: Bring forward the implementation of 2% BIK for electric vehicles to April 2019
attributes.background: The government want to encourage the uptake of electric vehicles to help reduce CO2 and improve the environment.  Benefit in Kind for electric vehicles is due to fall to 2% in April 2020 which will help with this. However it is due to rise to 16% in April 2019.
attributes.additional_details: Currently electric vehicles, particularly those with longer ranges that may suit company car users better, typically have a higher purchase cost than petrol or diesel cars.  Company car users typically keep the same car for 3 years so those making decisions now are likely to avoid electric vehicles because of the increased BIK in 2019.  Bringing the 2% BIK forward to April 2019 would mean that the company car users would be much more likely to choose an Electric Vehicle now.

attributes.action: Implement a statutory body to address animal abuse and prosecutions
attributes.background: The animal welfare crisis is spiralling out of control the government are in denial,enforcement and prosecution is lacking on a large scale.Animals need a robust and enforced system.It must move on from private prosecution and the state should prosecute as it does in every other area of the law.

attributes.action: Stop HS2 Developers Demolishing the *Wet Woodland* area at Denham Country Park
attributes.background: Wet Woodland should be protected by law! The area is clearly wet woodland, but not being recognised as such. There are approximately 2000 different wild species in this area. Once these areas are gone, they are gone for good!!
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be No Net Loss of biodiversity in London. We and our future generations cannot afford to lose these areas which are important for air/water quality and for general mental wellbeing of those that use these spaces. 

The Mid-Colne Valley Site of Metropolitan Importance (SMI) for nature conservation is too important to be lost. Priority habitats and species must not be swept under the carpet.

Wet woodlands are UK most productive habitats equal to our rain forests there are not many left in London.

attributes.action: Georgia’s law: Require stay drug safe measures and testing at all festivals
attributes.background: Georgia Jones died at Mutiny festival May 26th 2018 after taking two pills. All festivals should have drug safe measures. Alongside security checks and dogs, there should be clear warning signs of potential side effects. Front of house testing would also give more information to the individuals.
attributes.additional_details: Research has proven that all these measures do help and make people think twice, with half choosing not to take. Searches do not stop drugs getting in. Education and advice is what is needed.

attributes.action: New independent complaints & monitoring body for schools & local authorities
attributes.background: Legislation and DfE guidance state how schools and local authorities must comply with the law. If statutory guidance or duties are not followed, enforcement is left to solo families using ineffective complaint procedures, or the LGO service, which won’t act in the face of ultra vires local policies.
attributes.additional_details: This problem often relates to SEN support, mental or physical illness provision, bullying, or disability discrimination. The lack of accountability in the system creates severe difficulties for families & denies many children the support & education they need. ‘Not Fine in School’ call for a new independent, transparent & objective body to enable a fair complaints process, which is NOT investigated by the complained of services. This body must be empowered to monitor practices & instigate consequences when schools or local authorities use local (invalid) policies, or act in an ultra vires way.

attributes.action: A final say on the deal negotiated with the EU, with the option to Remain
attributes.background: Leave 'won' the Referendum, but voters have not had the opportuniy of seeing what the alternatives to our current membership of the EU are, and of deciding whether the likely economic, political and social consequences mean that it would be better for the UK to remain full members.
attributes.additional_details: The referendum was 'won' on a simple majority because it was said to be Advisory at the time. There was at the time no indication of the type of deal, or relationship, the UK would achieve with the 27 other members of the EU. The government later said it would respect the will of the people: but the people may well have voted differently had they known the result would be considered set in stone (mandatory referendum would require a supermajority.)

attributes.action: Abolish ASPA Section 24, the secrecy clause for animals used in UK laboratories
attributes.background: Four years after the Government undertook a public consultation review of Section 24 of the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986, the results are yet to be published. Animals continue to suffer and be subjected to inhumane procedures in UK labs, shielded from public scrutiny by this clause.
attributes.additional_details:
Section 24 contradicts the UK’s right to freedom of information and is at odds with commitments to transparency and public accountability within EU Directive 2010/63 on animals in research. Its repeal was widely supported by the House of Lords Select Committee and Animal Procedures Committee. Only abolition will allow public bodies access to challenge licences and decrease the unnecessary suffering of animals in the name of research.
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/research-and-testing-using-animals

attributes.action: Establish penalties against companies for systematic late payment of invoices
attributes.background: Freelancers make up 15% of the UK workforce, yet there has been little change in legislation to support this shift. In particular the lack of appropriate legislation around payment terms gives freelancers little practical power to ensure terms are enforced - resulting in serious cash flow issues.
attributes.additional_details:
A small survey of freelancers (97 people) found that everyone had experienced late payment and 37.5% had to wait over 6 months to be paid - some people were never paid. Companies should simply not be allowed to operate like this.

Options currently available include taking a company to small claims court, which is costly & time consuming, and late payment fines which are an inadequate solution as again require the invoice to at some point be paid - and don't fix cash flow issues.

attributes.action: Declare the 2016 referendum on membership of the EU null and void.
attributes.background: Under section 3.3 (e) of the CODE OF GOOD PRACTICE ON REFERENDUMS the UK government should declare the result of the 2016 referendum null and void because of the decision by the Electoral Commission that rules on spending were broken and referral to the police has been made.

attributes.action: Low cost path to CITIZENSHIP for all EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status
attributes.background: The Windrush crisis has shown that it is critical to provide fair protection for any of the 3 million law abiding EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status who contribute so much who consider the UK their home and contribute so much to our communities and Britain as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: EU Citizens without British Citizenship make a large net contribution to the UK in economic terms ( https://eu-rope.ideasoneurope.eu/2017/10/30/eu-migrants-give-take/ ) and so many other ways. The Windrush Crisis has shown that there can be no confidence in the promises made by the UK government when it comes to the protection of their rights. It is therefore critical that a low cost and simple path to citizenship is given to EU Citizens with PERMANENT RESIDENCY status.

attributes.action: All halal and kosher certified products are to be prominently labelled as such.
attributes.background: It is strictly forbidden for some Sikhs, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians to consume any halal or kosher certified product or religiously slaughtered meat. Without clear prominent labelling we could be consuming it without knowing. All we are asking for is clear labelling to make an informed choice.
attributes.additional_details: See Why don't Sikhs eat Halal meat? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ePhDUBWXf80&t=26s

attributes.action: Swansea Bay Tidal Lagoon: make it happen.
attributes.background: The delay on going ahead with the Swansea Bay Tidal Lagoon should be addressed. Everyone needs to understand why and how this project benefits the whole of Britain. As well as protecting our environment and addressing rising energy demands in near future not to mention generations to come.
attributes.additional_details: https://drive.google.com/file/d/12gAbollr0p4JOz-no2COcsLNRk4a8UV0/view

attributes.action: Ban MMA nail products from the nail industry.
attributes.background: MMA can be found in NSS salons. You will see on your local high street, you can walk in, It’s a rushed service, they always hurt your nails with use of the electric file on the natural nail, which gives this tool a bad rep. MMA use had been around for years. products containing MMA sell for less!
attributes.additional_details: MMA is most widely used bone & dental products! It’s used to fix broken bones & create dentures. The reason your natural nail is thinned so much prior to the application is because the product doesn’t adhere very well to the nail unless it’s thinned. This weakens your own natural nail & you would notice MMA nails are extremely tough and very difficult to break. I’ve known of people having to go to A&E because the nail is so badly damaged that they’ve had to have it surgically removed.

attributes.action: Make Legal Aid available for applicants forced to prove immigration status in UK
attributes.background: The Legal Aid, Sentencing and Punishment of Offenders Act 2012 saw Immigration being taken ‘out of scope’ for legal aid from 01.04.2013. This has affected people forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK, despite living here lawfully, including the Windrush era and their families.
attributes.additional_details: This petition calls on the Government to make Legal Aid available to all applicants who are now forced to prove their Immigration status in the UK and to help them secure confirmation of their entitlement to British citizenship.

attributes.action: Ensure cancer patients wait for no longer than a week for scan or test results.
attributes.background: There are currently no guidelines which determine how long a cancer patient should be expected to wait for scan or test results. This means that many patients are waiting for several weeks to know their fate. Inevitably, this holds up treatment and can lead to a worse outcome for the patient.
attributes.additional_details: At present patients with suspected cancer may have to wait for 62 days for test results to confirm a diagnosis. For those already diagnosed, there are no time limits for scan or test results. In our increasingly overstretched NHS, scan results are being given too late. This is an unacceptable situation which could be remedied. I am asking the government to ensure no cancer patient has to wait for longer than a week for test results so that their treatment isn't delayed or their choices limited.

attributes.action: Add Fibromyalgia & Rheumatoid Arthritis to NHS exemption fee list
attributes.background: Many diagnosed with these medical conditions both of which are non cureable need medication in order to have a liveable/maybe manageable quality of life.

attributes.action: Give free child care to all 2 year olds
attributes.background: Why should only parents on certain benefits receive childcare? For fairness, all 2 year olds should receive free childcare, regardless of background.

attributes.action: Launch an independent inquiry into the 5g Health & Safety risks
attributes.background: There seems to be much proof of the dangers of Mobile Phone masts as it is, and now 5g is to be rolled out with a far greater percentage of phone masts on every street in order to facilitate it. This is, given the evidence so far, a grave risk to each and every person in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
Dr Devra Davis
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BwyDCHf5iCY
Brain Tumours Links to Mobile Phone Use
https://academic.oup.com/ije/article/39/3/675/631387
Italian Court Rules Mobile Phones Cause Cancer
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2017/apr/21/italian-court-rules-mobile-phone-use-caused-brain-tumour

attributes.action: Preserve the rights of EU citizens to stand and vote in local elections.
attributes.background:
Fair and effective local democracy depends on having certainty over who can stand and vote in local elections.

Government should make a commitment, now, that all EU citizens legally resident in the UK should retain their rights to stand as candidates and vote in council elections after Brexit.
attributes.additional_details:
An urgent commitment is needed because political parties and independent candidates are already making preparations to campaign in the May 2019 local elections.

Note that this petition is silent about EU residents' rights to remain in the UK.  (That matter, unhelpfully, is still unresolved at the time of writing.)

This petition assures political rights to those EU citizens who are granted, or retain, legal rights to reside in UK.  The criteria for those residency rights is a separate matter.

attributes.action: Routinely test pregnant women for infections such as Group B Strep and more.
attributes.background: October 2017 the devastating news no parents want to here “your daughters heartbeat has gone”. I was suffering with an infection and Sepsis, while showing no early symptoms no one could of known I was ill with an infection, until they did a swab whilst in labour.
attributes.additional_details:
During pregnancy infections can be deadly to both baby and the mother, if my infection was picked up sooner It possibly could of been prevented and antibiotics could of been provided.

Infections during pregnancy are common such as Staphylococcus aureus and Group B Streptococcus. The NHS don’t routinely swab for any infections. If I had been tested around my due date when I'd been given the option to have an examination my infection possibly could of been prevented and any other infections could of possibly been picked up. If an examination is being taken place then a swab could be conducted to pick up any possible infections and stop babies, mothers becoming ill and prevent these types of stillbirths.

attributes.action: Ban The Sale of Live Plucked Down Products In The United Kingdom.
attributes.background: China supplies 80% of the worlds down. Geese are forcefully restrained and feathers ripped out. This process is repeated every 6-7 weeks, causing birds considerable pain and distress. Many are left with gaping wounds, some even die.
attributes.additional_details:
Workers often sew the birds’ skin back together without anaesthetic.
Down is still widely used in the UK Fashion and Bedding Industries with most supplied by China. Make it compulsory law that retailers only supply down that meets the Responsible Down Standard (RDS) http://responsibledown.org/ and the DOWNPASS standard 2017 https://www.downpass.com/en/downpass/standard.html and ban the sale of all live-plucked down in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Apply to rejoin the E.U on March 29, 2019.
attributes.background: If the United Kingdom leaves the EU on March 29, 2019, we want to immediately apply to rejoin even if this means accepting conditions such as Schengen borders and the common (EURO) currency.
attributes.additional_details: #stopbrexit

attributes.action: Immediately Review the Pubs Code
attributes.background: After 12 years of campaigning, the Pubs Code came in to practice July 2016. It was meant regulate the pubs industry and curb some of the unfair practices carried out by pub owning businesses that negatively affect pub tenants and the wider pub industry. It is not working and urgently needs reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: The Government set a review date of July 2019 to assess the efficacy of The Pubs Code. The failure of the Code has been so catastrophic it is imperative that the Government step in early and strengthen the grey areas of the Code. The simple argument is that an adjudicator has no legal powers, so the cash-rich pub owning companies are simply taking all the significant rulings made by the Pubs Code Adjudicator to the High Court and having them overturned.

attributes.action: Condemn the Faroe Islands for allowing the slaughter of endangered Cetaceans.
attributes.background: Every year, up to 1,000 migrating Pilot Whales and other dolphins are hunted and brutally killed in the Faroe Islands in a practice known as the ‘Grindadráp’ (or Grind). The cruel practice continues with the support of the Danish government, in conflict with their international legal obligations.
attributes.additional_details:
"An EU directive prohibits member states from all forms of deliberate disturbance, capture, or killing of cetaceans, however Sea Shepherd has evidence proving that Danish officials from the police, navy, and customs have been facilitating and even actively participating in the Grind." Sea Shepherd UK. 
We demand condemnation and ceasing of tourism and trade relations with the Faroe Islands until the Grind is ended in perpetuity. All evidence available to view on Sea Shepherd UK's Facebook page.

attributes.action: Once the Brexit process is finished give the public the final say on the deal
attributes.background: Once the process is all finished give the public the final say on it give them three simple choices: take the deal, meaning we leave with that deal; reject the deal and leave with no deal; or reject the deal and stay in EU.

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords and replace it with an elected upper chamber
attributes.background: Our government is not able to make decisions based on the will of the people because it has to get backing and approval from the House of Lords, an unelected chamber that does not reflect the will of the people. True democracy means that we should be able to vote for all members of parliament.

attributes.action: Impose legislation to stop charity bags being delivered to homes in the UK
attributes.background: charitybags.org.uk estimate that 525 million charity bags are delivered to homes in England & Wales per year – this would equate to 2,625 tonnes of plastic.
attributes.additional_details: They say only 3% are filled, meaning that a staggering 509 million bags may be ending up in landfill, contributing to the worldwide plastic problem.

attributes.action: Leave the EU now
attributes.background:
The Government is not going to achieve a satisfactory outcome from its negotiations with the EU. 
We should walk away now. 
No Deal is better than a bad deal.

attributes.action: Prime Minister to establish Windrush Day as a national day celebrating migration
attributes.background: Britain has been an island for over eight millennia, and over this period many have travelled here to make it their home. The arrival of the MV Empire Windrush on 22nd June 1948 heralded the first known mass migration to this island and marked a step change in the story of migration to Britain.
attributes.additional_details:
22nd June each year should be recognised as Windrush Day - a National Day of commemoration and celebration of migration and migrant communities in Britain.The Windrush Generation are part of the public memory of British history and achievement and thus should never be treated as criminals or easy targets as part of the current hostile immigration environment.

www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/may/09/windrush-shaped-britain-70-years-immigration-national-holiday

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ride a bike without a helmet.
attributes.background: In a majority of bicyclist deaths, the most serious injuries are to the head, highlighting the importance of wearing a bicycle helmet. 1 Helmet use has been estimated to reduce the odds of head injury by 50 percent, and the odds of head, face, or neck injury by 33 percent
attributes.additional_details:
What kids think on the subject. 
“Yes, it should be made the law because the only reason people don't wear helmets is because they would be made fun of. So if everyone wore one then no-one would be made fun of."

attributes.action: Annul the 2016 EU referendum result due to the overspend by Leave.EU.
attributes.background:
UK is a member of the Venice commission. The Venice commission's Code on referenda states (section 3.3 - Funding, Paragraph 24):

"In the event of a failure to abide by the statutory requirements, for instance if the cap on spending is exceeded by a significant margin, the vote must be annulled."
attributes.additional_details: Leave.EU have been found to have overspent spending limits by at least 10%. This is a clear violation of the Venice Commission and as a result, the Referendum result should be annulled and a new vote called.

attributes.action: We request a ban on issuing psychiatric drugs to children under 5 years old.
attributes.background: We strongly believe that the risk of potential harm from psychiatric drugs is too great to expose a young child’s brain to this risk. Countries like France have a ban until seven years of age. More research is needed in this field and caution is required until that point.
attributes.additional_details: We are aware that children as young as two could be being medicated with strong drugs designed for adult use, such as psychostimulants, antipsychotics or antidepressants. We have safeguarding concerns about this growing practice. Increasingly Educational Psychologists in the field are aware of such cases and this causes us great concern.

attributes.action: Allow the British people to vote on cannabis legalisation
attributes.background:
This Government stands on the shoulders of the phrase "will of the people" it should therfore agree, that the only way to settle this long term debate, is to allow a people's vote on cannabis legalisation. 

Join the campaign at Let Us Vote
 on twitter and facebook
attributes.additional_details:
Uk biggest exporter of legal cannabis 

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/health-44197038

Cannabis 114× less deadly than Alcohol

https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/weed-is-114-times-less-deadly-than-alcohol-study-finds-10066496.html

Violent crime rate reduced in states that legalise cannabis

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/world/2018/jan/14/legal-marijuana-medical-use-crime-rate-plummets-us-study

attributes.action: Amend the Wildlife Act so companies have to protect wildlife
attributes.background: There's nothing in the Wildlife Act which states that companies must put measures in place to prevent wildlife from being injured/killed whilst they are undertaking outdoor work. We want the Wildlife Act amended in order to reduce the number of animals going to rescues due to the work of businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The Wildlife Act needs to be updated in order to protect all wildlife. Companies have to take responsibility for their actions towards wildlife, for example, putting ramps down holes, covering up all holes, paying the bills of the animals they have injured and so on. By putting this in place, it will help reduce the number of injured or killed wild animals.

attributes.action: Stop Fracking in the UK
attributes.background: For years, communities have opposed fracking for environmental and health reasons which were dismissed as scaremongering.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/22/uk-fracking-push-could-fuel-global-plastics-crisis-say-campaigners 
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2018/aug/02/buried-uk-government-report-finds-fracking-increases-air-pollution

attributes.action: U.K. government to introduce National ID Cards to all legal citizens
attributes.background: The introduction of a U.K. national ID card has many benefits and few disadvantages. For example: it would improve security, reduce fraudulent claims to U.K. rights and benefits and make it more difficult to carry out other illegal activity. There are few possible reasons for valid objections.
attributes.additional_details: The principal objection to ID cards is that they are an infringement of citizen's right to remain anonymous. - this could easily be remedied by legislation under which circumstances an ID card could be requested I.e, voting, by police, claiming benefits or seeking employment. An ID scheme would also be hugely expensive. Estimated at £1 billion - but long term security and savings on crime makes this worthwhile. About 100 countries already have compulsory ID cards. Others have voluntary schemes.

attributes.action: make it a criminal offence for a parent to deny contact after a court order
attributes.background: Currently there is nothing preventing a parent from not abiding to a court access order, meaning the non resident parent will have to repeatedly return to court to have it enforced. This has a negative emotional impact on both the parent and children. It's also time consuming and very costly.
attributes.additional_details: The police agree this happens too often, but they cant help because it is not a criminal offence, and can only advise returning to court, but unfortunately this can become a never ending cycle . Some parents even go as far as trying to cut the other parent out Completely, which is known as parental alienation. Research is being done on the negative emotional impact losing time with a loving parent has on children, and the law needs to be updated to reflect this and protect children and families.

attributes.action: Universal Credit: split payments between adults in each household
attributes.background: The UK Government pays Universal Credit to 1 account per household. Charities have expressed concern this could increase the risk of financial abuse. Payments should be paid to individuals to avoid enabling financial coercion and women being trapped in abusive relationships due to lack of money.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information please see:
https://wbg.org.uk/analysis/briefing-papers/briefing-universal-credit-financial-abuse/
or
https://www.buzzfeed.com/emilyashton/this-mp-says-the-governments-own-welfare-system-is-trapping?utm_term=.sfdXrwbQN#.ggkXMWgGB

attributes.action: Stop Brexit if supplies of vital medication can't be guaranteed.
attributes.background: The Chair of the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency, said officials must ensure drugs don’t run out if there’s no Brexit deal. The Government is stockpiling medicines. This is not acceptable. Patients with long-term conditions need medication immediately or they could die.
attributes.additional_details:
We can't wait. Our supply of vital meds MUST be guaranteed. Some patients with long-term conditions need medication immediately or they could die. We can't wait. Our supply of vital meds MUST be guaranteed.
Diabetic-ketoacidosis has to be treated IMMEDIATELY with INSULIN otherwise the patient could DIE. This is just one example. Diabetes is the tip of the iceberg. Many other patients, asthmatics, for example, rely on life-saving medication imported from the EU. They can't wait whilst it's stuck at the port.

attributes.action: Pass a law guaranteeing free speech except for incitement to violence
attributes.background: Free speech is the bedrock of western civilisation and should be protected from prosecution. People in the UK should be free to say what they want, when they want and where they want. This should cover all public places and places of employment. The only exception is an incitement to violence.
attributes.additional_details: People should be free to speak their mind at home, in a public space and in a place of employment or worship. Without free speech the evils of society can not be confronted and individual rights can be eroded by the interests of groups.

attributes.action: Ban Aspartame and its associated sweeteners from all food and drinks in the UK
attributes.background: The use of Aspartame and its associated sweeteners are increasingly being linked to many illnesses and medical conditions and even obesity.
attributes.additional_details: Many people use them because of obesity and/or diabetes or to help reduce their sugar and calorie intake. These chemically produced sweeteners are believed to be detrimental to the health and well-being of the population. There are natural alternatives that can be used in place of them.

attributes.action: Create an independent Ombudsman to investigate & regulate Vet companies
attributes.background:
There is no Ombudsman for Vet Practices in the UK that is independent and external.

We have Ombudsman for communication, gas, electricity, NHS. When a consumer of a Vets company raises a complaint about a Vet company (not a vet) there is no Ombudsman for when things go wrong.
attributes.additional_details: There has been many cases in the press and complaints online of vet practices charging extortionate prices for out of hours treatment on their beloved pet. Vet companies can charge what they like, act how they like and time and time again get away with this leaving the consumer at the mercy of out of hours when their pet is injured or seek emergency treatment.

attributes.action: Fund seizure alarms for everyone with Epilepsy
attributes.background: I decided to start this petition after my son, 2 years old, got diagnosed with epilepsy and started to have nocturnal seizures. 1st December 2016 is when it all began with his first seizure - a 4 hour status seizure which resulted in him having to be placed into a coma on life support for 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Sudden Unexpected Death in Epilepsy (SUDEP) is when a person with epilepsy dies suddenly and prematurely, and no other cause of death is found. Around 1,200 people die from Epilepsy each year in the UK. Around half of these deaths are SUDEP (sudden unexpected death in epilepsy). If you have seizures during the night, having a seizure alarm that alerts someone if you have a seizure is a life changer. The Government must provide enough funding for everyone who needs one.
